Uses of SpoonScript in icap.services.resources.gs
 

Subclasses of SpoonScript in icap.services.resources.gs
 class JavaSpoonScript
          Extension of GreasySpoon script, in order to support direct Java coding without JSR223 overhead
Scripts must conform to NativeScript skeleton and are compiled and loaded in memory Compiled result is stored on disk but is more or less useless TODO: check if scripts are correctly unloaded from memory after deletion TODO: check if writing compiled class on disk has an interest or working in memory can be enough
 class Jsr223SpoonScript
          GreasySpoon script, synchronized with a script file on disk
scripts are updated based on file time stamp provided by the OS
Scripts files must include following header:
==ServerScript==
@name Say Hello!
@status on/off => allow to enable/disable script (enabled by default)
@description Script description
@include regex matching url (i.e: http://www\.google\.com/.* ) and for which script is applied
@include other regexes
@exclude regex matching url (i.e: http://gmail\.google\.com/.* ) and for which script does not apply
==/ServerScript==

Optional supported headers are:
@order 0..n ==> allows to ask this script to be executed in n position
@responsecode 0|2xx|3xx|5xx..
 

Methods in icap.services.resources.gs that return SpoonScript
static SpoonScript SpoonScript.loadFromFile(java.lang.String filename, Icap.TYPE mode)
          Create a new SpoonScript object based on given filename
